lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau ppIhw piRX piRX tyr hyry bUMd vYsy piqbRqw piqbRq pRiqpwl hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Papeehaa Priy Priy Tayr Hayray Boonda , Vaisay Patibrataa Patibrat Pratipaal Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a rain-bird longing for a Swati drop keep wailing making sound of  ' Peeu, Peeu' similarly a faithful wife fulfills her wifely duties remembering her husband,

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy dIp idpq pqMg pyiK j√çwrw jrY qYsy piRAw pRym nym pRymnI smHwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Deep Dipat Patang Paykhi Jvaaraa Jarai , Taisay Priaa Praym Naym Praymanee Samhaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a love-lorn moth burns itself on the flame of an oil lamp, so does a woman faithful in love lives her duties and religion (She sacrifices herself over her husband).

lines.gurmukhi: jl sY inks jYsy mIn mr jwq qwq ibrh ibXog ibrhnI bpu hwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Sai Nikas Jaisay Meen Mar Jaat Taata , Birah Biyog Birahanee Bapu Haar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a fish die immediately when brought out of water, so does a woman separated from her husband die of pangs becoming weak in his memory day by day.

lines.gurmukhi: ibrhnI pRym nym piqbRqw kY khwvY krnI kY AYsI koit mDy koaU nwr hY ]645]
lines.transliteration_english: Birahanee Praym Naym Patibrataa Kai Kahaavai , Karanee Kai Aisee Koti Madhay Kooo Naar Hai ?645?

Shabad OS B.translation: A separated faithful, loving and devoted wife who lives her life according to her religion is perhaps one in a billion.  (645)
